p: Compound 12c was also examined at two different concentrations (1 and 5 µM) for its ability to compete with colchicine for binding to tubulin using a [ 3H] colchicine binding assay. Compound 12c strongly inhibited colchicine binding to tubulin by 79% and 87% at 1 and 5 µM respectively, which compares with 86% and 97% inhibition by CA-4, respectively. These results suggest that compound 12c is involved in tubulin polymerisation inhibition through the colchicine-binding site.
